meanings.sent1: She will denay the request for extra time on the test.
meanings.sent2: The teacher may denay the student's request for a second chance.
meanings.sent3: The cat will denay any attempts to pet it when it's in a bad mood.
meanings.sent4: The locked door seemed to denay entry to anyone without the key.
meanings.sent5: The strict bouncer will denay entry to those without proper identification.

meanings.sent1: He will denay the false accusations made against him.
meanings.sent2: The witness may denay the statement given by the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The magician will denay any claims that his tricks are not real.
meanings.sent4: The mirror seemed to denay the reflection of the ghost standing in front of it.
meanings.sent5: The detective will denay the alibi provided by the suspect.

meanings.sent1: The guard will denay entry to those without tickets.
meanings.sent2: The club may denay access to individuals not on the guest list.
meanings.sent3: The treehouse will denay entry to anyone who doesn't know the secret password.
meanings.sent4: The force field seemed to denay passage to anyone trying to cross it.
meanings.sent5: The gatekeeper will denay access to the castle without the king's permission.
